title: Region bounded by algebraic f and line

content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A30@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let R be the shaded region in the second quadrant bounded by the graph of f, and let S be the shaded region bounded by the graph of f and line ℓ, the line tangent to the graph of f at x = 0, as shown above. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A30@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let R be the shaded region in the second quadrant bounded by the graph of f, and let S be the shaded region bounded by the graph of f and line ℓ, the line tangent to the graph of f at x = 0, as shown above. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) Find the volume of the solid generated when R is rotated about the horizontal line y = -2.
(c) Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that can be used to find the area of S.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
